item.title: Report X-2024081320
item.description:
Report X-2024081320

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-19
  • City: CORPUS CHRISTI
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: After examining the package, you can tell that the damage probably accrued from two different issues. One probably had the box laying on its side and the other probably had an heavy box on top of it as well. Because of this, one of the four bottles was crushed on top, causing liquid to come out from the open of a lose cap.

item.title: Report E-2024080438
item.description:
Report E-2024080438

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-21
  • City: GANADO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8880
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver had completed his delivery of diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank. The driver was unfamiliar with this tank's pump system and failed to completely drain the delivery hose. When he disconnected the hose, approximately 20 gallons of diesel fuel was released. Lonestar Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2024080443
item.description:
Report E-2024080443

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 15, 2024, at 1332 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by XPO personnel in Houston, Texas regarding the release of Stick-M-Up (UN3266, Corrosive Liquid, basic, inorganic, n.o.s., 8, II). Clean Harbors were dispatched to the site to perform all clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of a total of 5 gallons of Stick-M-Up from (3) 5-gallon plastic pails. The release was caused by a puncture and impacted the dock floor. Contractors cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (1) 30-gallon DF overpack, and (2) 55-gallon DF's then staged onsite for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080355
item.description:
Report E-2024080355

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: SANGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 30, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3266 was damaged by a skid and released approximately three (3) cups of product to the loading dock floor and drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the impacted site. The crew transferred all remaining QUORUM YELLOW LP (UN3266) material from the damaged 55-gallon drum into a new 55-gallon drum. ES&H personnel deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted areas, deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas, and swept them in with hand tools. All UN3266 impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum which was staged onsite.

item.title: Report X-2024080974
item.description:
Report X-2024080974

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: HASLET
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5496
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: JBHU 291460 was found leaking from the trailer. The unit was isolated in the Hazmat pit and notifications were made. A Hazmat contractor was contracted to investigate the source of the release. During inspection, it was found that 1 275 gallon plastic tote released approximately 2 gallons due to crack in the top of the container. The release was cleaned up and the material was transferred to a new container.

item.title: Report E-2024080371
item.description:
Report E-2024080371

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: ROBINSON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LWA experienced a UN1789 Blue Whale Muriatic Acid release. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-gallons of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor and a 4' x 4' area of concrete underneath the trailer. The release was caused due to the pallet collapsing possibly as a result of stacking. The impacted boxes and jugs were removed from the pallet. The impacted areas were then cleaned with absorbents and sodium bicarbonate. All impacted absorbents, debris, and damaged containers were collected into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
